intro: Montanoa uncinata, commonly known as the hooked montanoa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Montanoa uncinata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
